children: A 56-year-old woman is evaluated for boring epigastric pain, jaundice, weight loss, and dyspnea. A contrast-enhanced
is obtained to further evaluate abnormalities found on chest radiography.
Which of the following is the most likely pulmonary diagnosis?

This contrast-enhanced chest CT scan suggests metastatic carcinoma. There are multiple discrete nodular infiltrates of varying size scattered throughout the lungs. Although the differential diagnosis includes inflammatory and infectious causes, the appearance is consistent with metastatic cancer and is compatible with the patient's history. In this case, the diagnosis was metastatic adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.

objective.__html: Recognize chest CT findings suggestive of metastatic cancer.
